Contradict fact: The claim that COVID-19 vaccines will create millions of people with an autoimmune disease contradicts the fact that the authorized COVID-19 vaccines do not contain harmful ingredients and have undergone rigorous testing.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the potential negative impact of COVID-19 vaccines by suggesting that millions of people will develop an autoimmune disease, without providing evidence to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to substantiate the assertion that COVID-19 vaccines will lead to the development of autoimmune diseases in millions of people.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes a direct causal relationship between COVID-19 vaccines and the development of autoimmune diseases, without considering other factors or alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the potential development of autoimmune diseases, such as underlying health conditions or genetic predispositions, which may not be directly related to COVID-19 vaccines.
Falters at times: The claim falters in its reasoning and accuracy, as it ignores the extensive testing and safety measures that have been conducted for COVID-19 vaccines.
